enums.name: AnalyzeTextOutputType

values.name: FourSeverityLevels
values.doc: Output severities in four levels, the value could be 0,2,4,6.

values.name: EightSeverityLevels
values.doc: Output severities in eight levels, the value could be 0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7.

enums.doc: The type of text analysis output.

enums.name: AnalyzeImageOutputType

values.name: FourSeverityLevels
values.doc: Output severities in four levels, the value could be 0,2,4,6.

enums.doc: The type of image analysis output.

properties.name: text
properties.doc: The text needs to be analyzed. We support a maximum of 10k Unicode characters (Unicode code points) in the text of one request.

properties.name: categories
properties.doc: The categories will be analyzed. If they are not assigned, a default set of analysis results for the categories will be returned.

properties.name: blocklistNames
properties.doc: The names of blocklists.

properties.name: haltOnBlocklistHit
properties.doc: When set to true, further analyses of harmful content will not be performed in cases where blocklists are hit. When set to false, all analyses of harmful content will be performed, whether or not blocklists are hit.

properties.name: outputType
properties.doc: This refers to the type of text analysis output. If no value is assigned, the default value will be "FourSeverityLevels".

properties.name: blocklistsMatch
properties.doc: The blocklist match details.

properties.name: blocklistName
properties.doc: The name of the matched blocklist.

properties.name: blocklistItemId
properties.doc: The ID of the matched item.

properties.name: blocklistItemText
properties.doc: The content of the matched item.

properties.name: categoriesAnalysis
properties.doc: Analysis result for categories.

properties.name: category
properties.doc: The text analysis category.

properties.name: severity
properties.doc: The value increases with the severity of the input content. The value of this field is determined by the output type specified in the request. The output type could be ‘FourSeverityLevels’ or ‘EightSeverity Levels’, and the output value can be 0, 2, 4, 6 or 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, or 7.

properties.name: error
properties.doc: The error object.

properties.name: code
properties.doc: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

properties.name: message
properties.doc: A human-readable representation of the error.

properties.name: target
properties.doc: The target of the error.

properties.name: details
properties.doc: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

properties.name: innererror
properties.doc: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

type.name: InnerError
type.doc: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Microsoft One API guidelines - https://github.com/microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/azure/Guidelines.md#handling-errors.

properties.name: code
properties.doc: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

properties.name: innererror
properties.doc: Inner error.

properties.name: errorCode
properties.doc: String error code indicating what went wrong.

properties.name: image
properties.doc: The image needs to be analyzed.

type.name: ContentSafetyImageData
type.doc: The image can be either base64 encoded bytes or a blob URL. You can choose only one of these options. If both are provided, the request will be refused. The maximum image size is 2048 x 2048 pixels and should not exceed 4 MB, while the minimum image size is 50 x 50 pixels.

properties.name: content
properties.doc: The Base64 encoding of the image.

properties.name: BlobUri
properties.doc: The blob url of the image.

properties.name: categories
properties.doc: The categories will be analyzed. If they are not assigned, a default set of analysis results for the categories will be returned.

properties.name: outputType
properties.doc: This refers to the type of image analysis output. If no value is assigned, the default value will be "FourSeverityLevels".

properties.name: categoriesAnalysis
properties.doc: Analysis result for categories.

properties.name: category
properties.doc: The image analysis category.

properties.name: severity
properties.doc: The value increases with the severity of the input content. The value of this field is determined by the output type specified in the request. The output type could be ‘FourSeverityLevels’, and the output value can be 0, 2, 4, 6.

properties.doc: Array of blocklistItems to add.

properties.name: text
properties.doc: BlocklistItem content.

models.doc: The response of adding blocklistItems to the text blocklist.

properties.doc: Text blocklist name.

properties.name: nextLink
properties.doc: The link to the next page of items

properties.doc: The TextBlocklist items on this page

properties.name: blocklistItemIds

methods.name: analyzeText
methods.doc: A synchronous API for the analysis of potentially harmful text content. Currently, it supports four categories: Hate, SelfHarm, Sexual, and Violence.
